acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1 from its 96h-LC50 = 0.06 mg free chlorine/L (0.12 mg/L as calcium hypochlorite) for fish (Rainbow trout and Channel catfish) (SIDS, 2006).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on a LD50 value of >2000 mg/kg for rabbits (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified as "Not classified" in JIS Classification (correspond to Category 5 or "Not classified" in GHS classification).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
Based on a LD50 value of 790 mg/kg for rats (male) (SIDS (2004)), the substance was classified into Category 4.
[For health hazards, refer also to sodium hypochlorite.]

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the classifications of "Group 3" in IARC (IARC 52 (1991)), the substance was classified as "Not classified".

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1 since its acute toxicity is Category 1 and it is hard to forecast the behavior in water from which it varies with environmental conditions.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid (melting point >55 degC) substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: The substance is classified into Division 5.1 in UNRTDG (UN1748).

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on a negative result in a bone marrow micronucleus test by intraperitoneal injection to mice (in vivo somatic cell mutagenicity test) (SIDS (2004)), the substance was classified as "Not classified". As relevant information, from in vitro mutagenicity tests, there are reports of a positive chromosomal aberration test (SIDS (2004)) and a positive Ames tests (SIDS (2004)).

hazardous_to_ozone.rationale: This substance is not listed in Annexes to the Montreal Protocol.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: The substance is classified into Division 5.1, PG II in UNRTDG (UN1748).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. In a rat developmental test by oral administration during the organogenesis period, there were no effects on fetal development (IUCLID (2000)). In a one-generation reproductive toxicity test in rats, no reproductive toxicity was observed (SIDS (2004)). However, since hydrogen chloride or sodium hypochlorite was used in these tests, classification was not possible.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: The substance is classified as Oxidizing solids.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on reports of "corrosive" to the eyes of test animals (IUCLID (2000)), superficial loss of epithelium from corneas and conjunctivas following experimental application to eyes of rabbits for 30 seconds (HSDB (2002)) and a pH of 11.5 (HSDB (2002)), the substance was classified into Category 1. As relevant information, the substance is also corrosive to the skin.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on a report of "highly corrosive" to rabbit skin (IUCLID (2000)) and classification as C; R34 in EU classification (EU-Annex I (access on May 2009)), the substance was classified into Category 1.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Since the substance is on the Frosch contact allergen list (FROSCH, TEXTBOOK OF CONTACT DERMATITIS), the substance was classified into Category 1.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Inhalation of hypochlorous acid fumes causes severe respiratory tract irritation and pulmonary edema (HSDB (2002)). Since the information is reported in a document in List 2, the substance was classified into Category 2 (respiratory system).
